its scary how people feel the need to take power at the expense of everyone else
its actually so strong to the point where its sickening and pathetic

i only wish to know more about the inside details on what the us government is doing on a personal level, what an individual's environment is forcing him/her to do despite it being against what he/she believes in
or of the people actually believe that doing these things are actually beneficial

so far every single piece of information regarding what (specifically the NSA) government does with surveillance and mass data has actually been ineffective or does the opposite of what it was intended to prevent/stop

and its sad to see how a government is so blinded and relies in blaming of certain technologies and deceiving (including blatant lying) in order to do what they feel is ultimately in their self interest
and they feel that they are not fulfilling their self interest but instead fulfilling national security... when in fact they are blinded that this "national security" is their self interest
since the Snowden leaks, there are currently millions of people in their watch list
thats more than the population of many countries
and they have increased / are increasing surveillance

ive read so many times on different terrorists attacks (including 9/11) that the NSA had the data to prevent the attacks (or at least identify them) but have failed to do so due to the massive amounts of data they collect
along with the extreme tactics they use

its gotten so bad to the point where my personal view of someone NOT using encryption makes me feel like they are the one in the wrongdoing (even though this view is completely false, especially for the non-tech savvy)
yeah, its actually kinda sad how much the US spends on useless crap
almost 1 trillion per year just on military... thats more money than (again) many countries GDP combined
and the amount of money they put in surveillance and a false sense of security (such as the TSA and backdooring encryption)
yeah, but many peopel have creates wonderful peices of software that make encryption seamless and easy
some mail clients do this, chat messages, and a lot of these dont require any  setup... its just a matter of finding it and getting other peopel to use it (so you can communicate with them)
depends on the purpose
and depends on how "secure" you want to be, because ill recommend layering security if you are that paranoid :P
yeah, but those require either setup or a little technical knowledge
im talking something like your grandmther can use
ill give you an example
mynigma... its an email client that encrypts to other mynigma users
its open source
heck you can even use pgp on top of it... its just you need other peopel to use that piece of software
and yeah i agree with you, but sometimes peopel get interested in protecting their privacy but arent knowledgable on how
let me give you even a more prevalent example
iMessage from apple
yes, its not open source... but forget that for a second
pretend its end-to-end encrypted... i think apple claims this to be true although others believe otherwise
it only works if the person you are communicating with has another apple device such as an iphone
(plus an apple id)
however its not encrypted when sending to android or windows phones
there really isnt a universal standard to just simple everyday communication that works with everything  on every device
so sometimes people feel the convenience is greater than putting the effort to just use something that encrypts

i dont think apple notifies the user if communicaiton is encrypted or not... i just know this because the text is sent as an actual sms message instead of a chat message via a server (eg. using text vs data)
so if you send a message from an iphone to an android phone, its sent as a text... so that counts against the texts you can send, hwoever if its from iphone to iphone, it counts as data
yeah i see what you are saying
my problems is the surveillance the government(s) feel the need to do
first of all... when people know they are being watched, what they say and express themselves as change slightly... this affects freedom of speech
its also very invasive... there probably is nothing more invasive than this other than requiring people to strip down naked every time they want to enter or exit a security-tight building
yeah, you basically have to commit yourself to a whole other community (and a smaller one at that)
people say its security vs privacy... i disagree, i think they are closely related
its actually security/privacy (choose your word) vs convenience
its liek using a credit card vs cash
its a hell of a lot more convenient... but big money-hogging companies collect a lot of data about you just from using them
for the NSA... they are trying to make their job easier
they arent trying to make people safe or secure anything, they just want to have their jobs as easy as possible
if you read anything about how the heck they can even search through all their data... its like google but better
lol yeah, i can see that
yeah
people dont like to try to learn new things on computers, thats how you differ the tech savvy vs the ordinary
"the ordinary" wasnt very good wording but i hope it got the point across
and its understandable if people dont want to learn something new on a computer, sometimes its in their best interest not to
but sometimes when people dont want to just because "its faster" or "it saves time" is when it changes
sometimes i want to do something faster either because im in a hurry or am frustrated, but when i have the time i try to learn as much as possible (while keeping sanity)
of course i have the ambition to keep learning (im self taught in nearly everything i can do and know about computers, software and hardware)
yeah
that reminds me: the sony hack (remember that?)
the CEO (or some head guy) at sony said like a decade ago: its not worth spending 10 million on a breach that costs only 1 million
and when i heard that, i laughed so hard at the irony
because people who run HUGE global businesses who neglect security (they kept all their passwords in a file called passwords.txt)
his view is right, its just how the heck do you know you wont A) get hit HARD... or B) get hit multiple times
yes, but its kinda stupid for someone in a huge company to at least not invest in some security
heck, even security training will go even further than just having encryption in times
because if they had training on that, the hack might have been prevented because it was caused from a phishing email
his attitude is like this (in my view): get a lot of money now, worry about it later
instead of: im making a lot of money now, invest some to shape way for even more money in the future
or at least, in his case, prevent loss of money :P
(i hope you understand what im saying, im not trying to be really negative about this)
i do understand his perspective and it is true, its just naive of someone to not bother, you know what i mean?

its like: oh im not gonna bother organizing my stuff today, ill worry about it when i have to find it later... and then you are stuck in a time-crunch and you cant find what you need which causes you to be late to work or something like that
or: im not gonna bother backing up my data, it takes way too long and i trust my anti-virus to work... then you get hit with ransomware

its something simple and effective, but in the case of big business, if you can get away with not doing the preparations, you make A LOT of money, and if you dont get away with you, at least you can afford the costs
